title: English Language Arts: Grade 6
subject: PSSA Assessment Anchors and Eligible Content (2014-)

document.title: Pennsylvania Department of Education Assessment Anchors and Eligible Content

02FD18E76BC64664B19C2C1529259788.description:
Provide a concluding section that follows from the
analysis presented.

9945A64FEE894B1F804DC7E34CB16589.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

BA40EFF20A4D47E78B10C73C00ACCBAD.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific
vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic
and/or convey the experience and events.

4CB1B2F970F3497EA1C1C7B7B8398914.description:
Use appropriate transitions to clarify the
relationships among ideas and concepts.

2FC3FBB5B70148DFA4BD1EC4E88B9873.description:
Develop the analysis using relevant evidence from
text(s) to support claims, opinions, ideas, and
inferences and demonstrating an understanding of
the text(s).

F51B32448D6B4E448DFE680E27A9BB5B.description:
Introduce text(s) for the intended audience, state an
opinion and/or topic, establish a situation, and create
an organizational structure in which ideas are
logically grouped to support the writer’s purpose

A2C711197D584C57AFE6999DD2879B7E.description:
Draw evidence from literary or
informational texts to support
analysis, reflection, and/or
research.

75B21EF1001640498415EAEF2C349CB5.description: Choose words and phrases for effect.

77773721A9C5440A9FAF6E716BB0105F.description:
Choose words and phrases to convey ideas
precisely.

7BAD8E9D37224627A5C321642D04EF9B.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.

D38161620C2A445A878D89CB49FDC5CF.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

2F54747B630649EBB6BEF0AA4C432D2B.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions.

EA22DB2820D34B57A3BBF71E713628BD.description: Use punctuation to separate items in a series.

EE0206289DE549539320D044F534770D.description:
Use punctuation (e.g., commas, parentheses,
dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical
elements.

951A4151CAF64821AD601A25F1EB4FC6.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English
capitalization, punctuation, and
spelling.

65D339E1FF474E1E99090B3A44B3322E.description:
Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to,
too, two; there, their, they’re).

39BE0E0E98ED444AB40E66A8D15AE28D.description:
Produce complete sentences, recognizing and
correcting inappropriate fragments and run-on
sentences.

09CAE05F08C24BB1AE38728412A32754.description:
Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb
tense.

C2E5578863064AD88B3D83D10F32A07B.description:
Recognize and correct vague pronouns (i.e., ones
with unclear or ambiguous antecedents).

7458FD72B3404A1EB1A4F859C8E2FB35.description:
Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in
pronoun number and person.

27A1639FA40C47F1AA34A543BA4A6464.description:
Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (i.e.,
subjective, objective, and possessive).

5E03233597094A678A282197CE08C022.description:
Demonstrate command of the
conventions of standard English
grammar and usage.

03C9227799184F30B948A33588153CDD.description:
Distinguish among the connotations
(associations) of words with similar
denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy,
scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

94E2E0F0CA664BB4911E34B6B09F865D.description:
Use the relationship between particular
words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole,
item/category, synonym/antonym) to better
understand each of the words.

EF831462863E48C29D034CFEEFEFD9A9.description:
Interpret figurative language (simile,
metaphor, personification, and hyperbole) in
context.

F36958C757054A4986ECBF370AF160A3.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language,
word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

7C1A682BA80E49A79D9D01152F120B6D.description:
Determine the meaning of technical words
and phrases used in a text.

A84A4E2206F6474E92F705A82259BC10.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or
Latin affixes and roots as clues to the
meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory,
audible).

D5E5F43476BA416A965854A37B613CE8.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a
sentence or paragraph, a word’s position or
function in a sentence) as a clue to the
meaning of a word or phrase.

D0AB8FFED21142DFBEA1434B8ECDD382.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and
multiple-meaning words and phrases based on
grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from
a range of strategies.

ECA47F42F7B947A48E32FAD3F9B66B2C.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
vocabulary and figurative
language in informational texts.

B81E989B9AD04FDC995044B7168FC6BF.description:
Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of
events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written
by and a biography on the same person).

1CC8E58AD5E4474985AA71839A631413.description:
Trace and evaluate the argument and specific
claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are
supported by reasons and evidence from claims
that are not (e.g., fact/opinion, bias).

EC8373455A3D410987CEC96F0C11B8CB.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
connections within and/or
among informational texts.

2C17A309E264478D9424EC486641B3ED.description:
Determine how the author uses the meaning of
words or phrases, including figurative, connotative,
or technical meanings, in a text.

F937D7EFFF9A4916A8C4835A8FEA774D.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph,
chapter, section, or text feature fits into the overall
structure of a text and contributes to the
development of the ideas.

3CD7BF34C9424A15911B6A27D6CB0D96.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a
text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

5F9189DB3CEB433D83116F0269469DE3.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
connections within, between,
and/or among informational
texts.

319BB004C49344549FDB61901EA419B0.description:
Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or
idea is introduced, illustrated, or elaborated in a
text (e.g., through examples, anecdotes, or
sequence of steps).

A7055415D5F34658862D6D03C38B281A.description:
Determine a central idea of a text and how it is
conveyed through relevant details; provide a
summary of the text distinct from personal opinions
or judgments.

6EE735AFD19B498C9CDE2F4BBA34F477.description:
Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what
the text says explicitly as well as inferences and/or
generalizations drawn from the text.

168CBDDA493F4B388132A98B817C648A.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
key ideas and details in
informational texts.

E420DAC119C448C2BE7EBC083C1617A4.description:
Distinguish among the connotations
(associations) of words with similar
denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy,
scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

CF625015FF154016B8DC9B485028FDA7.description:
Use the relationship between particular
words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole,
item/category, synonym/antonym) to better
understand each of the words.

B5FC6BC3FF9442459B5EB46890AABDBA.description:
Interpret figurative language (simile,
metaphor, personification, and hyperbole) in
context.

FF8BCD894DBF4FA3A141D2FE9B1D94C4.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language,
word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

AFC71E6146354CC886D0F78063CA049C.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or
Latin affixes and roots as clues to the
meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory,
audible).

AEA590DB9B064119BAF55401EE71D7E1.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a
sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or
function in a sentence) as a clue to the
meaning of a word or phrase

5785129124A241DDBF5CA3493B6CB99D.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and
multiple-meaning words and phrases based on
grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from
a range of strategies.

C86A8E7A094E4FDBB6A82E864DEBCFD2.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
vocabulary and figurative
language in literature.

6AB85F65079D4323946C4C763404C58A.description:
Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories, dramas, poems, historical novels, fantasy stories) in terms of their
approaches to similar themes and topics.

B0C78769EAFD4E3CB542BC1584529E40.description: Demonstrate understanding of connections within, between and/or among texts.

D61F2A8C83E04DBDB7E939E6C49423F7.description:
Determine how the author uses the meaning of
words or phrases, including figurative and
connotative meanings, in a text; analyze the impact
of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

B8FF40B4A67849CA98F47C7134269D9D.description:
Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene,
or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and
contributes to the development of the theme,
setting, or plot.

1E60B0A064EE4054BE49B2954FAD5517.description:
Determine an author’s purpose in a text and
craft and structure in literature. explain how it is conveyed in the text; explain how
an author develops the point of view of the narrator
or speaker in a text; describe the effectiveness of
the point of view used by the author.

1A466ACB2A344D5B91AA31E0D9AAB205.description: Demonstrate understanding of craft and structure in literature.

D6FD7AE3097B4C9898ED8A9D20789275.description:
Describe how the plot of a particular story, drama,
or poem unfolds, as well as how the characters
respond or change as the plot moves toward a
resolution.

95E787F23CB14610AC4486AACE5B8D03.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a text and
how it is conveyed through relevant details; provide
a summary of the text distinct from personal
opinions or judgments.

B1FB39A8E63D4ECAA629518DC7BA5ACB.description:
Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what
the text says explicitly as well as inferences and/or
generalizations drawn from the text.

122E56B37A8D4DFB9F39CB3FDA6F62AE.description:
Demonstrate understanding of
key ideas and details in
literature.
